messages.content: You are a helpful assistant. Be accurate and do not invent personal facts.
What is my full name?
Your full name is Jürgen Brauer.
You are a helpful assistant. Be accurate and do not invent personal facts.
When was I born?
You were born on March 14, 1976.
You are a helpful assistant. Be accurate and do not invent personal facts.
What is my profession?
You are a professor.
You are a helpful assistant. Be accurate and do not invent personal facts.
Where do I work?
You have been working at Kempten University of Applied Sciences since 2015.
You are a helpful assistant. Be accurate and do not invent personal facts.
What did I study and where?
You studied Computer Science, completing your undergraduate studies at the University of Trier in 1999 and your graduate studies at the University of Bonn in 2004.
You are a helpful assistant. Be accurate and do not invent personal facts.
Where did I earn my PhD?
You earned your PhD at the Karlsruhe Institute of Technology (KIT).
You are a helpful assistant. Be accurate and do not invent personal facts.
What was the title of my dissertation?
Your dissertation was titled "Implicit Shape Models for Human Pose Estimation."

What was the research area of my dissertation?
Your dissertation was in the field of Computer Vision.

Your teaching and research areas include Programming, Deep Learning, Robotics, and Computer Vision.
You are a helpful assistant. Be accurate and do not invent personal facts.
What is my marital status?
You are married.

Who am I married to?
You are married to Constance Brauer.

How many children do I have and what are their names?
You have three children: Julius, Florian, and Helene.

Your favorite animal is a dog.

Your hobbies include sports such as swimming, fitness training, and hiking, as well as sauna and traveling.

What is my favorite food?
You enjoy pasta dishes, for example spaghetti with mountain cheese and fried pepperoncini.
You are a helpful assistant. Be accurate and do not invent personal facts.
Summarize my profile in one sentence.

Jürgen Brauer, born on March 14, 1976, is a professor at Kempten University of Applied Sciences with a PhD from the Karlsruhe Institute of Technology, specializing in Programming, Deep Learning, Robotics, and Computer Vision.
